intro: Eleocharis decoriglumis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and lakes. Eleocharis decoriglumis plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
